instructors.name: מר ערן שחם
instructors.description: מנהל בית הספר להייטק וסייבר באוניברסיטת בר-אילן, בעל ניסיון עשיר של למעלה מ-30 שנים כמרצה ומנהל הדרכות בתחום הסייבר ואבטחת המידע, מנהל מרכזי הדרכה מורשים של החברות המובילות בעולם בתחום הווירטואליזציה, תקשורת ואבטחת מידע, יזם, הקים וניהל את קורסי התעודה במחשבים ביחידה ללימודי המשך של 'מוסד הטכניון' במשך 8 שנים, הקים וניהל את 'מלם-תים הדרכה', ניהל את קהילת אבטחת המידע במיקרוסופט ישראל.

instructors.name: מר דורון יעקובוב
instructors.title: Data Product Manager
instructors.description: בחברת Mobileye, בעל ניסיון עשיר בניהול פרוייקטים מקצה לקצה בשווקים הבטחוניים והמוניציפאליים, בדגש על טכנולוגיות IoT, בעל ניסיון רב בהדרכה (כ-10 שנים) כמרצה ומנהל הדרכות בעולמות התוכנה והדאטא, בעל תואר ראשון בהנדסת חשמל ואלקטרוניקה, בהתמחות מערכות משובצות מחשב.

instructors.name: מר ליאור לריאה
instructors.description: מוביל מקצועי של טכנולוגיות ה-dashboarding בקורס, מרצה מומחה של Tableau, בעל ניסיון של 24 שנים בעולמות הדאטה.

instructors.name: מר איליה לוין
instructors.title: Training Specialist
instructors.description: מוביל מקצועי של טכנולוגיות AWS בקורס ומרצה מוסמך מטעם AWS, ארכיטקט ענן ו-Training Specialist בחטיבת הענן בדלויט, בעל 6 הסמכות של AWS ובעל 4 הסמכות של GCP, ותק של 10 שנים בהדרכות והנחיה מקצועית.

summary: המסלול השלם להכשרת מפתחי בינה עסקית ומומחי FinOps הוא קורס מקיף המיועד להכשיר מומחים בתחום הבינה העסקית וה- FinOps. הקורס מתמקד בטכנולוגיות מידע מתקדמות, כולל SQL Server, Python, Front End ו-Back End, SSIS, ו-Dashboarding. בנוסף, הקורס מכסה את תחום הענן וה- Financial Operations, עם דגש על שליטה בעלויות הענן וייעול ניצול השימוש בו. התלמידים ילמדו טכנולוגיות ענן של AWS ויתנסו בבחינה הבינלאומית AWS Practitioner. הקורס מציע הזדמנויות תעסוקה לבעלי רקע פיננסי ומספק כלים טכנולוגיים משמעותיים לשימור היתרון היחסי של הידע הקודם. התלמידים ייצרו תיק עבודות להצגה מול מעסיקים בתהליך הקבלה למשרות בתחום.
full_text: COURSE NAME: Business Intelligence Developer & FinOps Specialist. COURSE OVERVIEW: The comprehensive program for training Business Intelligence Developers and FinOps Specialists is a central field in information technologies in recent years. The need to handle vast amounts of data and the abundance of business insights has become increasingly significant. The curriculum at the School of Hi-Tech and Cyber Security trains Business Intelligence experts in data research, developing techniques to extract business insights from raw data stored in the company's database, producing competitive knowledge with added value for company managers. During the course, students install a SQL Server-based database, perform SQL and Python queries, continue with Front End and Back End developments (SSIS), and conclude with building a quality Dashboard to present business insights. In addition to BI technologies, students are exposed to cloud and Financial Operations (FinOps) during the course. The cloud technology offers many advantages: flexibility, broad access for all organization members, a wide range of services, and more. However, within these advantages lies the greatest challenge for cloud users: controlling cloud costs and monitoring usage patterns. FinOps includes two main areas: Cost Control, based on analyses, reports, alerts, resource tagging, etc., and Cost Optimization, through deep technological understanding, financial tools, and architectural changes. As cloud technologies penetrate our lives and many companies move their server and application infrastructures to the cloud, there is a growing need in the market for professionals capable of making business decisions on Billing and Cost Optimization and choosing between cloud solutions from different manufacturers. As an authorized AWS academy in Israel, students open an account on the AWS academy site and learn the manufacturer's cloud technologies through practical experience and even take the international AWS Practitioner exam. In the next stage, students will specialize in various FinOps technologies and practice these skills based on data similar to real-world scenarios. The fields of BI Developer and FinOps Specialist open a window of opportunities for students with a financial background in the job market, providing a significant technological toolbox while maintaining the relative advantage of previous knowledge. The portfolio created by the student during the course can be presented to employers during the job application process in these fields. COURSE LEADERSHIP: Program Manager: Mr. Eran Shaham, Director of the School of Hi-Tech and Cyber Security at Bar-Ilan University. Professional Advisors: Mr. Doron Yakobov, Data Product Manager at Mobileye, with extensive experience in end-to-end project management in security and municipal markets, focusing on IoT technologies. Mr. Lior Laria, Professional Leader of dashboarding technologies in the course, expert lecturer of Tableau, with 24 years of experience in data fields. Mr. Ilya Levin, Professional Leader of AWS technologies in the course, certified AWS lecturer, Cloud Architect, and Training Specialist at Deloitte's cloud division, with 10 years of professional training experience. TARGET AUDIENCE: Graduates of Business Administration, Economics, Accounting, CPA, Information Systems, and candidates with a business background interested in combining business processes with technological tools. PREREQUISITES: Admission interview by an academic advisor. Good reading and understanding of technical English. COURSE SCHEDULE: Start Date: 17.12.2024. Duration: Approximately six months. Classes on Tuesdays from 17:30 to 21:30 and Fridays from 09:00 to 13:00. Additional makeup classes may occur on non-regular class days. The program includes 200 academic frontal hours. TUITION AND FEES: Registration Fee: 480₪. Tuition Fee: 12,500₪. Exams: International certification exams are external and require additional payment to the exam center. LEARNING FORMAT: Classes are held at the School of Hi-Tech and Cyber Security, Bar-Ilan University Campus, Ramat Gan. Depending on Home Front Command and university instructions, some classes may be conducted via Zoom. CERTIFICATIONS AWARDED: Attendance of 80% of the meetings and completion of program tasks and final presentation are required. Successful participants will receive two certificates from Bar-Ilan University, School of Hi-Tech and Cyber Security. COURSE TOPICS: Intro to Business Intelligence + SQL Basics (20 Academic Hours): Familiarity with BI, Functions and job role of BI Analyst, Basic select statements, Filtering and sorting the results, Scalar functions, Group functions, Join methods, Sub Queries, Add, modify, or remove data from a table (DML). Managing SQL Objects (10 Academic Hours): Creating and managing tables, Working with Indexes, Understanding Execution Plans. T-SQL Programming (5 Academic Hours): Working with variables, Loops and conditions, Creating and using stored procedures, Creating and using functions, Cursors, Error Handling and Triggers. Advanced SQL Querying (20 Academic Hours): Using CTEs and Recursion, Advanced usage of subqueries, Analytic Functions, Window Functions. Business Intelligence and Dashboarding Using MS Excel (10 Academic Hours): Reference Types, Working with Data Tables, Statistical Functions, Pivot Tables, Merging data using VLookup, and XLookup, Advanced reporting using array functions, Building and customizing dashboards. Introduction to Data Using Python (40 Academic Hours): Python language fundamentals, Variables, program flow, functions, data structures, Using Python to import and shape data from varied sources, Data Analysis using the Pandas library, Data Visualization. SQL Server Integration Services- SSIS (25 Academic Hours): Introduction to DWH concepts, Introduction to SQL Server Integration Services, Developing Integration Services Solutions, Implementing Control Flow, Implementing Data Flow and SCD Methodologies, Configuring and Deploying Packages. Creating Reports and Dashboards with Tableau (25 Academic Hours): Tableau Basic Workflow & Features, Using Visualizations To Present Data, Using Calculations & Formulas, Joining Data From Different Sources, Data Preparation, Visuals, Dashboards and Stories, Advanced techniques in Tableau, Parameters and Analytics. AWS Cloud Practitioner (15 Academic Hours): Define what the AWS Cloud is and the basic global infrastructure, Describe basic AWS Cloud architectural principles, Describe the AWS Cloud value proposition, Describe key services on the AWS platform and their common use cases (for example, compute and analytics), Describe basic security and compliance aspects of the AWS platform and the shared security model, Identify sources of documentation or technical assistance, Describe basic/core characteristics of deploying and operating in the AWS Cloud. FinOps Specialist (25 Academic Hours): Cloud Concept and overall review, Main Cloud Services, FinOps – What is it and why is it needed?, Cloud pricing and billing, Finance tools and options (commitments, agreements, etc.), AWS cost explorer introduction, Use case + brainstorming, Cost Control – Tags, Alerts, Budgeting, etc., Use case + brainstorming, K8S- Introduction, high-level technical review, FinOps POV, FinOps third-party tools and products, Cloud cost monitoring, Tips for success + best practices, Final Exam/Exercise – based on AWS Cost Explorer. Personal Branding in a changing Job Market (5 Academic Hours): How to reach your dream job, Digital platforms for personal branding, Leveraging use of Linkedin for job search, Guidelines for writing CV’s and how to manage ATS (Applicant Tracking Systems), Building a professional plan for career development. Building a winning presentation (5 Academic Hours): The importance of presentations, Using tools and techniques for creating presentations, Learning how to demonstrate your speech in public speaking, Connecting the skills to your final project presentation. Final Presentation and Course Graduation (10 Academic Hours). REGISTRATION AND CONTACT INFORMATION: Information Center: *9392. Main Office: 03-5318254. Designated Programs Department: 03-5317957.
